5.3.19  5:01 am   so i'm trying to apply your oft-repeated suggestion of "practice? forget that, i say do it for real!" to my life. thing is, i want to be a tattoo artist and i don't have any connections for apprenticeships or friends who want me to tattoo them. is it reasonable for me to buy green soap, needles, etc. and just start tattooing myself to get things started??

     no, for that i think you're gonna want to start with something more fake, just due to the permanent nature of tattoos

5.2.19  6:56 pm   what if instead of sharps and flats we just made them their own letters

     i made a system for that, i settled on QRS, JK (for F# Ab Bb, Db Eb). this is what felt the most natural to me, and also preserve the existing letters which i have known all my life. Unfortunately, the system still fell into disuse because no one else was using it and i was still already accustomed to the existing system

     video

5.2.19  5:58 pm   When's the last time you update your website?

     today, and the time before that was yesterday, and so on

5.2.19  5:51 pm   4.30.19  10:27 am It's like how you have several parts of your brain (limbic system, frontal lobe, occipital lobe, etc.) and even if some of them act independently of the others, "you" are still "aware of" what they do (create emotion, make judgements, process vision, respectively). And, in the case of, say, the occipital lobe, even if the neurons never receive signals from each other directly, the lobe is still "aware" of what the neurons do (aware meaning affecting behavior. In this case, what the neurons do determines how the lobe behaves, i.e. what it communicates to the other parts of the brain, and so we say the lobe is "aware of" the neurons' actions. Same applies for part of your brain affecting "you").
The ABC scenario is a just simple example of this Russian-nesting-doll of consciousness, where higher levels are aware of the thoughts of lower levels, but not vice-versa. My theory is that, just as a human has independent parts yet feels like a single experiencing mind and not like millions of tiny neuron minds, so too may there be a higher level of consciousness that feels like me and only me, you and only you, Benedict Cumberbatch and only Cumberbatch, … , and perhaps some non-person thoughts exclusive to the higher-level-consciousness.
That's what I mean by everyone is everyone else. By the theory, we are all just one entity that experiences many localized, I-am-me-and-noone-else perspectives. Of course I feel like me, and you feel like you. But that feeling of individual identity does not mean that our experiences are not just the thoughts of one single entity.

     you are probably right

5.2.19  12:24 pm   Can you give me a random string of notes?

     use random dot org. set the maximum to how many notes you want to choose from, then click it for as many notes as you want. write down the numbers and then convert them to notes

      If not then why not?

     i would do it for you but i have to keep working on a video which takes way too long considering it's not even that long

     ah, you must complete the 12 levels of suffering, then the 13th which is the unlucky last and final level; the reason it is unlucky is because after you finish it you will be informed that there is another level after that
